definitions.definition: The action of stopping operations ; a closing , of a computer, business, event, etc.
examples: You need to enter your password at startup, but it's not required at shutdown .
There is a plastic molly-guard covering the escalator 's shutdown button to prevent little kids from pushing it and stopping the escalator.

definitions.definition: A statement , insult , etc. that prevents the opponent from replying further.
examples: When he insulted me, my reply was such a shutdown that he left the room.

definitions.definition: An autistic response to stress or sensory overload , in which the individual freezes up and becomes silent , motionless , and unresponsive .
A defensive ploy that prevents the opposing players from attacking .

main_definition: The action of stopping operations ; a closing , of a computer, business, event, etc.
secondary_definitions: A statement , insult , etc. that prevents the opponent from replying further.
( psychology , autism ) An autistic response to stress or sensory overload , in which the individual freezes up and becomes silent , motionless , and unresponsive .
( sports ) A defensive ploy that prevents the opposing players from attacking .
